headline: Electronic Arts LBO bond plunge raises fears of change-of-control payout defeasance
summary: Bonds backing Electronic Arts Inc. stabilized after a precipitous plunge on Feb. 10, but the slump drew attention to a $750 million print of 2051 bonds that holders were expecting to offload at 101 following a take-private transaction slated to close by early 2027. Inked in February 2021, the 2.95% 2051 bonds included a standard provision that requires EA to repurchase all or a portion of the notes at 101% of par in the event of a change of control and subsequent fallen-angel downgrade from two

headline: Are Wall Street Analysts Bullish on Electronic Arts Stock?
summary: Although Electronic Arts has outpaced the broader market over the past year, analysts maintain a cautious stance on the stock’s forward outlook.

raw.headline: Are Wall Street Analysts Bullish on Electronic Arts Stock?
raw.summary: Although Electronic Arts has outpaced the broader market over the past year, analysts maintain a cautious stance on the stock’s forward outlook.

headline: NetEase Q4: Revenue Miss Aside, I See Upside Brewing
summary: NetEase delivered modest 3% YoY revenue growth, driven by strong performance from self-developed games and new content updates. See why NTES stock is a buy.
